intro: Cryptantha crassisepala var. elachantha, commonly known as the slender-fruit cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a compact, mat-forming growth habit. Its seeds are enclosed in narrow, elongated pods, which contribute to its common name. The species is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
